featureDesc: Success in battle increases your aggression.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, each time you have a successful attack against an opponent, you may increase your Ticker value by +1.

featureDesc: The whirl of battle loosens your inhibitions and strengthens your tolerance to pain.
featureBenDesc: While Engraged, you gain +2d6 temporary Hit Points.
featureNote: Temporary Hit Points are always lost first. If you are no longer Enraged, you lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from this Feature and all such related Features.

featureDesc: The intoxication of battle compels you to seek out more combat.
featureBenDesc: As an Immediate action while Enraged, if you fatally wound or destroy your primary opponent you may choose to make an additional attack at your full Melee attack modifier against any one other secondary opponent within 5â€™ of your Reach.

featureDesc: Your attacks are vicious and difficult to defeat.
featureBenDesc: Once per Encounter while Enraged, you may choose to re-roll one Combat Check against an opponent.  This Advantage can be used immediately after an otherwise failed attack has been resolved.
featureNote: You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You have committed violent acts in battle, and you liked it.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, your Ticker value is increased by your Madness Point value. Your Ticker is immediately reduced by the same amount if you are no longer Enraged or unable to participate in Combat for on full round.

featureDesc: Your rage in battle is especially violent.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, your Ticker value is increased by your Madness Point value. Your Battle Rage now lasts 1d4+1 rounds longer. Once per day, if you dispatch or destroy an opponent while using Battle Rage, you may enter into a Violent Rage. Violent Rage lasts for number of rounds equal to 1 + your Madness Points. During Violent Rage, your Combat Check roll increases by +1d4. When Violent Rage ends, you may return to your previous Enraged state as long as you have remaining rounds and still have opponents within Reach of 1 Pace. At the end of any Encounter in which you use Violent Rage, you become Exhausted and cannot become Enraged again until you have had at least an hour of Full Rest.

featureDesc: Your pain turns to anger and that anger strengthens you.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you suffer any Combat damage from an opponent using a melee weapon, you may deal +2 points of additional damage on your next successful melee attack roll against that opponent.
While Enraged, you now instead gain +3d6 temporary Hit Points.

featureDesc: You desire to crush your enemies and spill their blood.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if you fatally wound or destroy your primary opponent you gain a +1d4 bonus to your next Combat Check roll.

featureDesc: Your attacks are even more vicious and difficult to defeat.
featureBenDesc: You may now use your Overwhelming Strike once per Encounter for each opponent that you face.
featureNote: You must notify the Storyteller of your desire to use this Feature immediately after the failed roll is resolved.

featureDesc: You enjoy the carnage and violence that you bring to a fight.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. While Enraged, for each consecutive round that you succeed at a Melee attack, you deal a temporary cumulative +1 point of additional damage on each of the following successful attacks.
featureNote: If you are no longer Enraged, or if you fail at a Combat Check roll, you lose all accumulated additional damage from this Feature.

featureDesc: You are the first to draw blood.
featureBenDesc: While Enraged, if your Turn is first in a given round, you may automatically deal 1d4+5 points of damage to any one new opponent that you have not yeat dealt damage to during the Encounter.

featureDesc: Your rage in battle is especially violent.
featureBenDesc: Gain +1 Madness Point. Your Battle Rage now lasts until the end of the Encounter, or until you are no longer able to be Enraged. You may enter Violent Rage once per Encounter now instead of once per day and it lasts for 1d4+Madness points. Once per day, if you suffer at least 10 points of lethal damage while in a Violent Rage, you may enter into a Blood Rage. Once per day, if you suffer at least 10 points of lethal damage while in a Violent Rage, you may enter into a Blood Rage. During Blood Rage, your Combat Check roll increases by +2d4. When Blood Rage ends, you may return to your previous Enraged state as long as you have remaining rounds and still have opponents within Reach of 1 Pace.
